head: SAUGUS REMEMBRANCE TRAIL
body1: While the Paris Climate Accord of 2015 was a remarkable achievement, it revealed the inadequacies of the participating nationsâ€™ commitments to greenhouse gas reductions. The subsequent withdrawal of the United States further indicated the limits of these commitments. In contrast, there was robust attention to climate change at the local and institutional level. Even before Paris,
body1a: had begun developing plans to mitigate and adapt to the effects of climate change.
body2: It had become clear that if nations simply achieved the Paris goals this risked being too little too late. Because public demand for energy and other carbon-producing processes ultimately drove GHG emissions, it was hoped that engaging the public would reduce demand more quickly. Addressing climate change would depend on the participation of all. The Salem Remembrance Trail traces significant milestones in climate change and the fight against its effects on the community.
body3: The Saugus Remembrance Trail is a public art installation that connects viewers to the challenges communities face from climate change and the ongoing local efforts to address them.
